question_sets.context:
One day, Tom's parents told him that his grandpa would retire after working for forty years. They were going to have a surprise party for him.
 Tom loved his grandpa and wanted to do something special for him. He remembered his grandpa gave him a business card two years ago. He knew that his grandpa would no longer have the job on the card, so he decided to make a new one for him.
 When the big day came. Tom was ready. He didn't want to put his gift together with others'. He carried it with him in the evening. When all the other people left after dinner, he gave the gift to his grandpa.
 His grandpa smiled, "Well, it must be a beautiful gift. May I open it now?" "Sure! " Tom said happily.
 As Grandpa opened the gift, tears (眼泪）came into his eyes. He got the greatest gift. It was a business card with his new position: FULL-TIME GRANDPA!
 "What can I get every day, my dear?" his grandpa asked. "As many hugs （拥抱) as you want! " With these words, Tom gave Grandpa a warm hug. "Thank you. I'm the richest man in the world! " said Grandpa happily.
根据材料内容选择最佳答案。

questions.text: What does the underlined word "retire" mean in Chinese?
questions.explanation: "retire" means "退休" in Chinese.

questions.text: Tom decided to ______ for his grandpa.
questions.explanation: Tom decided to make a new business card for his grandpa.

questions.text: When did Tom's family have the surprise party?
questions.explanation: Tom carried the gift with him in the evening.

questions.text: How did Grandpa feel when he got the gift?
questions.explanation: Tears came into his eyes, and he was very happy.

questions.text: Which of the following is TRUE?

choices.A: The full-time grandpa will get lots of hugs.
choices.B: The grandpa had worked for less than forty years.
choices.C: Tom was the first one to give his gift to his grandpa.
choices.D: Tom gave his gift to his grandpa together with others'.

questions.explanation: Tom said his grandpa can get as many hugs as he wants.

question_sets.context:
Having a hobby is a great way to relax after work or after school. Here are three hobbies for you to try.
 ◇Flower arranging（插花）
 If you like plants, think about flower arranging. Many flower shops have classes for beginners, so you can learn it in one of them. It's also a good idea to read books or visit websites. After you learn flower arranging, you can use the flowers to make gifts or make your home more beautiful.
◇     ▲    
 Do you dream of being a writer? Well, now it is the nice time to make your dream come true. To start with, you don't need to be very good at writing. Spend some time writing something in a notebook every day. You can also try making a short story. By practicing, you can make your writing better and better.
 ◇ Painting
 Painting is a fun and relaxing thing, but many people think it is hard. In fact, it is not. At first, you may find it is not easy to draw, but it doesn't matter. The most important is that when you draw, you are enjoying the beauty of art. If you have a busy life, this is a nice hobby for you to relax yourself.
根据材料内容选择最佳答案，

questions.text:
Where can we learn flower arranging according to the text?
 ① In a flower shop.② At school.  ③ On the Internet.   ④ From a friend.
 ⑤ From a book.
questions.explanation: Many flower shops have classes; read books or visit websites.

questions.text: Which of the following can be put into " ▲ "?
questions.explanation: The paragraph is about writing, so 'Writing something' fits best.

questions.text: Who should take painting as a hobby according to the writer?

choices.A: A man who lives a relaxing life.
choices.B: A girl who likes beautiful flowers.
choices.C: A Student who likes reading stories.
choices.D: A woman who is very busy with her work.

questions.explanation: If you have a busy life, this is a nice hobby for you to relax yourself.

questions.text: What does the writer think of painting?
questions.explanation: Painting is a fun and relaxing thing.

questions.text: In which part of a newspaper can we read the text?
questions.explanation: The text talks about hobbies, so it belongs to the 'Interests' section.

question_sets.context:
Some people think riding bicycles isn't popular. They aren't interested in it. So less and less people ride bicycles in the city. Nowadays some office workers usually go to work by car. Most students take the bus or the subway to go to school.
But I don't think so. I think riding bicycles is good for my health. It has many benefits（益处）.Firstly, when I am riding a bicycle, my whole body is exercising all the time. It is a good way to keep fit. Usually most office workers are busy with their things and most students are busy with their lessons, so they have no time to do sports. So riding bicycles is a good way to keep healthy for them.
Secondly, riding bicycles does good to our environment（环境）. As we know, driving cars can pollute（污染）air. It makes the temperature higher day by day, If we go to work by bike, the air will become cleaner than before. We can also save money at the same time. Why not enjoy doing it?
Riding bicycles is good for our health and the environment. We should all ride bicycles.

questions.text: How do some office workers go to work?
questions.explanation: The passage states that nowadays some office workers usually go to work by car.

questions.text: Riding bicycles is <blank> to keep fit for students and office workers.
questions.explanation: The passage says riding bicycles is a good way to keep healthy for office workers and students.

questions.text: What does the writer want us to do in the third paragraph（段）?
questions.explanation: The writer wants us to ride bicycles in the third paragraph.

question_sets.context:
It's a hot summer night. Rachel, "Grandma says quietly. "Get up. 1 have something to show you. Come with me. "Then hand in hand, they walk out of the house.
Today, Rachel and her parents drove two hours from New York City to send her big sister, Claire, to sleep away camp（野营）. Then they drove another four hours to Grandma's house in this quiet countryside.
Outside, it is dark. Grandma turns on a flashlight（手电筒）and starts walking.
"Where are we going? "Rachel asks, a little worried.
"You'll see, says Grandma. Then they walk to the forest.
Rachel sees some yellow lights and asks," What are they?"
"Fireflies（萤火）,"says Grandma.
They follow the lights. Then, suddenly, they arrive at a clearing（林中空地）, and Grandma turns off her flashlight. Fireflies are everywhere. The forest shimmers as if it's full of stars.
"They' re talking to one another," Grandma says. "They talk with light."
"What are they saying? "Rachel asks.
"I really don't know," Grandma says. "It's a secret language. Spend enough time with them, and maybe you'll find it out."
For a long while, Rachel watches the lights. She imagines（想象）she and her sister are two of the fireflies. They are telling each other secrets.
Walking back to Grandma's house, Rachel isn't sleepy at all. "Grandma" Rachel asks.
"Yes?"
"Can we do this tomorrow too? "
Grandma gives Rachel a big smile.

questions.text: Claire doesn't go to Grandma's house because she <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage says that Rachel and her parents drove to send her big sister, Claire, to sleep away camp.

questions.text: Grandma turns on her flashlight when <blank>.
questions.explanation: Grandma turns on her flashlight before entering the forest because it is dark outside.

questions.text: The underlined word "shimmers" means" <blank> "in Chinese.
questions.explanation: "Shimmers" means 闪烁 in Chinese.

questions.text: Which of the following is TRUE according to the passage?

choices.A: Rachel had a really scary night.
choices.B: Rachel understood the language of fireflies
choices.C: Rachel fell in love with the forest with fireflies.
choices.D: Rachel's grandma taught her science about fireflies.

questions.explanation: Rachel asks if they can visit the fireflies again tomorrow, so Rachel fell in love with the forest with fireflies.

question_sets.context:
An earthquake may happen at any time all over the world. It's best for us to know what to do before the earthquake and how to do during the earthquake. These information will help you.
Prepare your earthquake bag.
Before the earthquake, at any time, please collect seven things and put these things into an earthquake bag and keep it near you: water, food, medicine, mobile phone, torch（手电筒）, washing things, money and so on.
Sit, hide（躲藏）and hold.
When the earthquake happens, if you are indoor, sitting on the floor in a doorway or close to the wall. Don't be afraid to remember to protect your head and neck with your arms at once. Hide yourself beside something like a table, a bed and so on. Hold the furniture（家具）. You won't move away. Don't try to run out of the house.
Never do these things.
During the earthquake, if you are outdoor, don't run back into the house, don't stand close to the buildings because they may fall on you. Don't stand under the trees or signs. You had better stand in an open space.

questions.text: What should we know before and during the earthquake?<blank>
questions.explanation: It's best for us to know what to do before the earthquake and how to do during the earthquake.

questions.text: If we are indoor, what should we hold during the earthquake?
questions.explanation: Hold the furniture（家具）. You won't move away.

questions.text: If you are outdoor, you'd better <blank> during the earthquake.
questions.explanation: You had better stand in an open space.

questions.text: Which is the best title of the passage?

choices.D: Where to Stay during the Earthquake.

questions.explanation: This passage tells us how to keep safe in the earthquakes.

question_sets.context:
If you have a smartphone（智能手机）,the Internet is always with you. You can use the Internet for shopping, learning and chatting with your friends and so on. But the Internet can also be a

dangerous place. So, you must be careful.
Keep your personal（个人的）information. First, don' t share too much your personal information on the Internet. For example, don't send your phone number or number of a bank account （账号）.Be careful what you say on the Internet. Second, you can't let everyone see your everything. Finally, be careful of new people. Don't believe them exactly （完全地）. Some of them are dishonest（不诚实的）. They usually use the Internet to try to get money by cheating. The Internet is a good way to meet new people, but be careful. It is important for us to control information.
It is very important for us to be honest. Don't post other people's pictures. Don't hurt others. It's also smart to keep away from fights on the Internet. Don't answer rude（无理的）messages and so on. In this way we can have a better Internet place.

questions.text: When you have a <blank> , you can use the Internet at any time.
questions.explanation: If you have a smartphone（智能手机）,the Internet is always with you.

questions.text: If you want to control your information well, you shouldn't <blank>.
questions.explanation: Don't share too much your personal information on the Internet.

questions.text: How many suggestions does the writer make to protect personal information?
questions.explanation: The writer makes three suggestions to protect personal information: First, don't share too much your personal information on the Internet. Second, you can't let everyone see your everything. Finally, be careful of new people.

questions.text: To make the Internet a better place, we should <blank>.
questions.explanation: It is very important for us to be honest. Don't post other people's pictures. Don't hurt others.

question_sets.context:
One day, Mr. Smith took a plastic（塑料的）apple to class. He stood in front of the classroom and said, "Please smell the smell（闻气味）in the air!”
One student put up his hand and answered, "I have smelled it. It is the smell of an apple."
Mr. Smith walked to the students, passed by each of them and said, "Please smell again to see if the smell of the apple is still in the air."
Half of the students put up their hands to show that they could smell it. Mr. Smith returned to the front of the classroom and asked again if the students could smell the apple. Everyone said yes but one student, Henry. Mr. Smith went to him and asked," You really can't smell the apple?"
Henry answered,“No, I can't smell it. I don't think it's a real（真的）apple."
Mr. Smith smiled and said to the class, "He is right! This is not a real apple. It doesn't have any smell."
All of the other students were surprised. Some of them might have thought that the apple was not real, but they didn't have the confidence（自信）to speak up. They just "followed the leader" and went along with the first student.

questions.text: How many students said they smelled the apple when Mr. Smith asked for the second time?
questions.explanation: Half of the students put up their hands to show that they could smell it.

questions.text: What can we know about Henry?

choices.C: He was the best student in Mr. Smith's class.
choices.D: He wanted to be different from other students.

questions.explanation: Henry said“No, I can't smell it. I don't think it's a real apple.

questions.text: Mr. Smith used the apple to <blank>.

choices.D: play a game with his students

questions.explanation: Mr. Smith used the apple to teach his students a lesson.

questions.text: What does the passage mainly tell us?

choices.B: What you see is what you get.
choices.C: Two heads are better than one.
choices.D: Saying and doing are two things.

questions.explanation: This passage mainly tells us to believe in yourself.

question_sets.context:
Welcome to the biggest store in Europe ---- Harrods!
Harrods is one of the busiest stored in London. Nearly 35,000 people come to the store every day and more than 4,000 people work here.
Ann goes shopping there with the help of the store information. The following are the store information and Ann’ receipt.

Notes : LG: lower ground floor ; G: ground floor

questions.text: What’s Harrods according to the passage?
questions.explanation: According to the passage, Harrods is the biggest store in Europe.

questions.text: How many workers are there in Harrods?
questions.explanation: According to the passage, more than 4,000 people work in Harrods.

questions.text: How does Ann go shopping in Harrods?

choices.A: By asking the people who work there
choices.D: By calling her friends for help

questions.explanation: According to the passage, Ann goes shopping there with the help of the store information.

questions.text: Ann should go to if she wants to buy some books.

questions.text: How much should Ann pay according to the receipt?
questions.explanation: The passage doesn't provide enough information to determine how much Ann should pay.

question_sets.context:
Long ago, people made up interesting stories to explain what causes lighting and “thunder”. To many people, lighting and thunder can be very frightening especially because they often happen just before a big rainstorm. Actually, having a better understanding of something can make it less frightening.
Lightning is caused by electricity building up inside a cloud. When a large amount of warm air and cold air come together high above the earth, it causes a lot of movement in the air. The cold air moves down while the warm air moves up, which creates something like friction（摩擦）. An electric charge builds up in the clouds. The charge gets stronger and stronger until the explosion（爆炸）happens ---- and the LIGHTING flashes.
When the lighting flashes, the air around it becomes unbelievably hot --- fie times hotter than the surface of the sun! The heated air becomes larger and larger and gets into the cooler air around it, causing the big shock wave that we call thunder. We now know what causes lighting and thunder. Have you ever noticed that you often hear thunder just a few seconds after you see lighting? In a joke, people even said the reason was our eyes are in front of our ears! In fact, that’ because it is lighting that causes thunder. If the storm is far away from you, there are a few second between the lighting and the thunder. If the storm is close to you, you hear the thunder almost at the same time that you see the lighting.
Even though we usually see lighting before we hear the thunder that it causes, the two events happen just a fraction（部分）of a second（瞬间）apart. In addition, both light and sound travel through the air in waves. However, light waves travel faster than sound waves, so the light waves from the explosion（爆炸声）get to us first.
In our daily life, something similar to lighting and thunder can happen when you brush your feet along a carpet（地毯）and then touch a doorknob. You can sometimes hear the little sizzle（咝咝声）of mini-thunder, and see the flash of mini-lightning.

questions.text: Why did the writer talk about people making up interesting stories in the first paragraph?

choices.A: To lead in the topic of this passage.
choices.B: To help readers become less afraid of the nature.
choices.C: To get people interested in the stories about lightning and thunder.
choices.D: To help readers better understand the stories behind lightning and thunder.

questions.explanation: The writer mentions the stories to introduce the topic of lightning and thunder.

questions.text: What is “ thunder” according to the passage?

choices.A: An explosion developed by air friction.
choices.B: A sound created by electricity in the air.
choices.C: A heat produced by the surface of the sun.
choices.D: A large wave caused by the growing heated air.

questions.explanation: Thunder is described as a large shock wave caused by the heated air getting into the cooler air.

questions.text:
Which of the following is the correct order of lightning and thunder’s happening?
①The air around it becomes five times hotter than the surface of the sun.
②An electric charge gets stronger and stronger, then the explosion happens.
③It causes a lit of movement in the air when warm cold air come together high above the earth.
④ The shock wave called thunder happens when the heated air becomes larger and larger and gets into the cooler air around it.
questions.explanation: The correct order is: warm and cold air come together, electric charge builds up, air becomes hotter, and then thunder happens.

questions.text: Why do we usually hear thunder a few seconds after seeing lighting?

choices.A: We are very close to the storm.
choices.B: Our eyes are in front of our ears.
choices.C: Lightening is the cause of thunder.
choices.D: Sound waves travel faster than light waves

questions.explanation: The passage says that lightning causes thunder, and light waves travel faster than sound waves.

questions.text: What can we learn about lightning and thunder from the last paragraph?

choices.A: They can be seen and heard anytime anywhere.
choices.B: Things like them might also happen around us.
choices.C: We should be careful and not get hurt by both of them.
choices.D: Brushing your feet along a carpet can be very dangerous.

questions.explanation: The last paragraph explains that similar phenomena can occur in everyday life, such as when brushing your feet on a carpet and touching a doorknob.

question_sets.context:
We live in a much better life than we used to. However, health is still a problem all over the world. Sometimes it seems quite serious.
People need more health care, especially in developing countries. Look at the following table made by World Health Organization (WHO).
The table shows that developed countries have 20 per cent of the world's population but take 90 per cent of the health care. For example, a Japanese spends five hundred dollars on health care every year. However, a person in a poor country spends only three dollars a year!
There is another health problem in developing countries. Fifty years ago, people lived a life of about forty-six years on average(平均).Now most people in the world live twenty years longer than before. People in the poorest countries, however, live a much shorter life than people in developed countries. There are thousands of patients in poor countries; most of them are children. In 2002, almost 57,000,000 people died of different kinds of diseases. And nearly 20 per cent were children under five.
It's time for us to do something to help these children!

questions.text: <blank> makes the table(表格)in the passage.
questions.explanation: The table is made by WHO.

questions.text: According to the passage, people in <blank> may need more health care.
questions.explanation: India is a developing countries.

questions.text: How much does a Japanese usually spend on health care for a year?
questions.explanation: A Japanese spends 500 dollars on health care.

questions.text: What's people's life expectancy(平均寿命)at present?
questions.explanation: People's life twenty years longer than before.

question_sets.context:
I was telling my boy Sonny the story of the hare and the tortoise. At the end I said, “Son, remember: Be slow and steady (镇定的), and that will win the race. Don’t you think there’s something to learn from the tortoise?”
Sonny opened his eyes wide, “Do you mean next time when I’m entering for the 60-metre race I should wish that Billy, Tony and Sandy would all fall asleep halfway?”
I was shocked, “But the tortoise didn’t wish that the hare would fall asleep!”
“He must have wished that,” Sonny said, “Otherwise how could he be so foolish as to race with the hare? He knew very well the hare ran a hundred times faster than he himself did.”
“He didn’t have such a wish,” I insisted. “He won the race by perseverance (坚忍不拔), by pushing on steadily.”
Sonny thought a while. “That’s a lie,” he said. “He won it because he was lucky. If the hare hadn’t happened to fall asleep, the tortoise would never have won the race. He could be as steady as you like, or a hundred times steadier, but he’d never have won the race. That’s for sure.”
I gave up. Today’s children are not like what we used to be. They’re just hopeless.

questions.text: The writer wanted his son <blank>.
questions.explanation: The writer want his son to learn from the tortoise.

questions.text: According to Sonny, it was the tortoise’s wish that <blank>.

choices.A: the hare would be as steady as he was
choices.B: he could run faster than the hare
choices.C: the hare would fall asleep during the race
choices.D: he would have a sleep during the race

questions.explanation: Sonny thinks hare would fall asleep during the race.

questions.text: Sonny believed that the tortoise won the race <blank>.
questions.explanation: Sonny believed that the tortoise won the race by luck.

questions.text: It is clear that the writer <blank> in the end.
questions.explanation: The writer learned a lesson.

question_sets.context:
Weekday mornings are very busy for US middle school students. When your school doesn’t have a bus, and you live too far away to walk, you need a carpool (拼车). A carpool is a group of people sharing the responsibility (责任) of driving to school in the morning. There are usually four or five kids in a carpool and their parents take turns to drive the kids in their cars.
Someone’s car smells like wet dogs. Some kids get to eat desserts (甜点) for breakfast and some parents shout so much that all you try to do is to stay quiet and go unnoticed. When your mom or dad drives the carpool, your classmates get a close-up look at how strange your parents can be. It might be your first sociological (社会学) study and your first time to work with others.
Teamwork is really important in the carpool because nobody wants to make everyone else late. It’s a great lesson in responsibility. Imagine (想象) sitting in the car outside of a classmate’s house, watching the clock and counting the seconds. Then you start to understand how your carpool friends might feel when you are still inside the house at 7:48. You really begin to learn all your real life lessons just moments before the start of school—in the carpool.

questions.text: What is a carpool?

choices.A: Parents take turns to drive their kids to school.
choices.B: Parents drive kids to schools on their way to work.
choices.C: Kids go to school in their parents’ cars.
choices.D: Kids drive their own cars to school.

questions.explanation: Parents take turns to drive kids to school.

questions.text: How many kids are usually in a carpool?
questions.explanation: There are usually four or five kids in a carpool.

questions.text: What can students learn from a carpool?

choices.B: How to get along with others.

questions.explanation: Students learn teamwork from a carpool.

questions.text: Which of the following is TRUE?

choices.A: If kids live far away from school, they are always late for school.
choices.B: US children enjoy carpooling better than taking a school bus.
choices.C: Kids can learn real life lessons in a carpool.
choices.D: Kids often have enough time to study in a carpool.

questions.explanation: Kids can learn real life lessons in a carpool.

question_sets.context:
The panda lives only in the mountain bamboo forests of Southwest China. There are only about 1,000 wild pandas left in the world. Pandas are members of the bear family. They wear a white coat with some black bands(条纹). Their favourite food is bamboo. However, if they are very hungry and cannot find bamboo, pandas may eat grass, fruits, or sometimes, small animals like chicken.
Pandas do not live in groups. They only leave their home from March to May to look for a mate(配偶). A mother panda usually has two babies once. Baby pandas are very small, pink and weigh about 140 grams when they are born. Mother pandas feed their babies with milk. A baby panda opens its eyes at six to seven weeks. It starts to learn how to walk when it is about three or four months old. Mother pandas look after their babies for about 18 months. Once the young is strong enough, it says goodbye to its mother and moves out to live by itself.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT TRUE about pandas?

choices.B: There are only about 1,000 pandas in the world.
choices.C: They are members of the bear family.

questions.explanation: There are only about 1,000 wild pandas left in the world. So B is wrong.

questions.text: According to the passage, pandas may eat all the following except(除了) _____.
questions.explanation: Pandas may eat grass, fruits, or sometimes, small animals like chicken. So D is the answer.

questions.text: What does a baby panda look like?

choices.A: It is white with black bands.
choices.B: It is very small and pink.

questions.explanation: Baby pandas are very small, pink and weigh about 140 grams when they are born.

questions.text: How long do mother pandas look after their babies?
questions.explanation: Mother pandas look after their babies for about 18 months.

questions.text: The passage tells us about _____.
questions.explanation: The passage tells us about living habits of pandas.

question_sets.context:
The Spring Festival is a traditional Chinese festival. Chinese people do a lot to celebrate this great festival. For example, they have a big dinner, light fireworks, and make dumplings and so on.
In 1983, when CCTV held its first Spring Festival Eve Variety Show（春节联欢晚会）, watching the evening show became a very important part of the big festival.
On Spring Festival Eve, families chat on and on when they have delicious dishes around the table. But at 8:00pm, when the party begins, people all over the country turn their eyes to the TV. “Watching TV has become a habit for my family that night,” said Zhang Tianlu, 13, from Shanghai. “I can’t imagine what we would do without it.” The show usually lasts five hours. Young people can watch some of their favourite pop stars. These stars sing and dance. “My family love the show because of its short plays,” said Xu Dong, 14, from Nanjing. “After a year’s hard work, it’s very good that family members can relax and have fun together.”

questions.text: Chinese people __________ to celebrate the Spring Festival.
questions.explanation: Chinese people do a lot to celebrate this great festival.

questions.text: On Spring Festival Eve, __________ has become a very important part of the night.

choices.A: watching the Spring Festival Eve Variety Show

questions.explanation: Watching the evening show became a very important part of the big festival.

questions.text: The first Spring Festival Eve Variety Show was held in __________ by CCTV.
questions.explanation: In 1983, when CCTV held its first Spring Festival Eve Variety Show.

questions.text: Usually the show lasts __________ hours.
questions.explanation: The show usually lasts five hours.

questions.text: Xu Dong’s family like watching __________.
questions.explanation: My family love the show because of its short plays.

question_sets.context:
One day, I took my seat in a stadium to watch an Australian football game. It was crowded with fans. Suddenly, I heard some great commentary (现场解说) from a boy. He was bringing the game to life. I turned and saw him. There was another boy sitting next to him and listening to him carefully.
Then I heard about their stories from others. The two boys named Mark and Jarryd are best friends. When Mark was nine, he had an illness which took away his sight and his ability (能力) to play Australian football. However, throughout the years, Jarryd has always been with his closest friend and watched every game with him. They still share their love of it.
After knowing that, I hardly watched the game. Instead I was looking back at Jarryd and Mark. Jarryd told Mark about the game clearly and excitedly from time to time. Mark listened carefully. He was lost in the magic of Australian football.
Sports can be interesting. However, they can also allow us to share wonderful moments with others. Here, the two boys have moved me with their great friendship.

questions.text: What did the writer probably think of the commentary?
questions.explanation: The passage mentions "some great commentary", implying the writer found it wonderful.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Main Idea Identification

questions.text: Because of the illness, Mark is unable to <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states that the illness took away Mark's ability to play Australian football.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.text: What does the underlined word "that" refer to (指的是)?
questions.explanation: "That" refers to the whole story of friendship between Mark and Jarryd and how Jarryd helped Mark to enjoy the game.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Reference Words; Inference Skills

questions.text: Why did the writer pay more attention to the boys instead of the game?

choices.A: Because the boys' friendship moved him a lot
choices.B: Because the writer couldn't watch the game clearly
choices.C: Because the writer had already known the final result
choices.D: Because the writer wanted to listen to Jarryd's commentary

questions.explanation: The last sentence indicates that the writer was moved by their friendship.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Author’s Purpose

questions.text: What can we learn from the passage?

questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Main Idea Identification; Inference Skills

question_sets.context:
When an astronaut gets out of a spaceship or a space station in space, we call it a spacewalk.
Alexei Leonov from Russia became the first to go on a spacewalk on March 18, 1965. Zhai Zhigang is the first Chinese spacewalker, and he did a spacewalk on September 27, 2008. On November 7, 2021, he went on a spacewalk again with another Chinese woman astronaut Wang Yaping. They stayed outside Tiangong space station for 6.5 hours.
Why do astronauts go on spacewalks? That's because they need to work outside the spaceship or the space station, for example, doing science experiments. Sometimes they have to repair things. When there is something wrong with the outside of the spaceship or the space station, astronauts need to go on spacewalks to repair it. There are some ways for astronauts to train for spacewalks. One is by going for a swim. Floating (漂浮) in space is a lot like floating in water. It's more difficult than moving your body on land. Another way that astronauts train for spacewalks is by using virtual reality (VR). They wear a helmet (头盔) with a video screen inside. The screen can show a video of what they will see during the spacewalk. At the same time, they wear special gloves so that they can feel like they have been in the spacewalk.

questions.text: When did Alexei Leonov go on the spacewalk?
questions.explanation: The passage directly states that Alexei Leonov went on the first spacewalk on March 18, 1965.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.text: What do we know about Zhai Zhigang?

choices.A: He is the first astronaut from China
choices.B: He has already done two spacewalks
choices.C: He is the world's second spacewalker
choices.D: He taught Wang Yaping to walk in space

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that Zhai Zhigang is the first Chinese spacewalker and that he did a spacewalk again on November 7, 2021, which means he has done two spacewalks.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Supporting Details

questions.text: The underlined word "repair" means <blank> in Chinese?
questions.explanation: "Repair" in English means "维修" in Chinese.

questions.text: What can we learn from the last paragraph?

choices.A: There is a video screen outside the helmet
choices.B: It is easier to float in space than to move on the earth
choices.C: The special gloves can keep astronauts warm in space
choices.D: Astronauts need to get training before going on spacewalks

questions.explanation: The last paragraph describes the training methods, implying that astronauts need training before spacewalks.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Main Idea Identification

questions.text: What does the passage mainly talk about?
questions.explanation: The passage mainly discusses spacewalks, including its definition, history, reasons, and training.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Main Idea Identification; Summarization

question_sets.context:
On November 17th, 2022, Qatar's first Panda House was open to all people. The Panda House is the new home to two giant pandas, China sent them to Qatar (卡塔尔) as a gift.
The pandas took a special plane to Qatar on October 19th. Before that, they lived at a study centre in Sichuan Province. Si Hai is a three year-old female (雌性的) panda, while Jing Jing is a four-year-old male panda. After they arrived there, they were renamed Soraya and Suhail. Both names mean "stars in the sky" in Arabic (阿拉伯语).
The Panda House is in Doba, the capital of Qatar, It covers an area of 120,000 square metres and can provide the perfect indoor climate (气候) for the pandas. China flies about 1,000 kilograms of fresh bamboo to Qatar every week to feed the two animals. A team of Chinese experts taught local keepers how to take care of the pandas. One important job for these keepers was to learn the Sichuan dialect (方言). The pandas know the dialect of their hometown very well. So communicating with them in it can help them get used to the new environment.
It is the first time that giant pandas have travelled from China to the Middle East. The pair will stay in Qatar for 15 years. "This is a gift from all the Chinese to the people of Qatar for the World Cup," said Zhou Jian, China's ambassador (大使) to Qatar, "It stands for the friendship between China and Qatar."

questions.text: What can we learn about the two giant pandas?

choices.A: Si Hai is one year older than Jing Jing
choices.B: Their new names have the same meaning
choices.C: They arrived in Qatar on November 17th
choices.D: They grew up in a zoo in Sichuan before

questions.explanation: The passage mentions that both new names mean 'stars in the sky' in Arabic.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.text: Which is NOT mentioned in Paragraph 3?

choices.A: The size of the Panda House
choices.B: The location (位置) of the Panda House
choices.C: The way the two pandas get their food
choices.D: The difference in raising pandas between the two countries

questions.explanation: Paragraph 3 mentions the size, location, and food supply but does not mention differences in raising pandas.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Fact vs. Opinion

questions.text: Why did the keepers in Qatar learn the Sichuan dialect?

choices.A: To get a better understanding of Chinese culture
choices.B: To learn more about the hometown of the pandas
choices.C: To help the pandas get used to living in Qatar
choices.D: To have better communication with Chinese keepers

questions.explanation: The passage states that communicating in Sichuan dialect can help the pandas get used to the new environment.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Supporting Details; Cause & Effect

questions.text: What can we infer (推断) from the last paragraph?

choices.A: The two pandas won't return to China until 2037
choices.B: The World Cup is popular among the Chinese people
choices.C: Sending gifts is a useful way to make friends in Qatar
choices.D: It's difficult for giant pandas to live in the Middle East

questions.explanation: Since the pandas will stay in Qatar for 15 years starting from 2022, they won't return until 2037.

questions.text: The writer writes this passage to <blank>.

choices.A: advise readers to protect giant pandas
choices.B: ask readers to watch the giant pandas
choices.C: teach readers how to keep giant pandas in Qatar
choices.D: tell readers something about the giant pandas' journey to Qatar

questions.explanation: The passage mainly provides information about the pandas' arrival and new home in Qatar.

question_sets.context:
Did you see snow in your home town last winter? Did you feel it was warmer than before? “There have been 21 warm winters in China since 1986,” said scientists. They also said that in the past 100 years, as the global (全球的) temperatures went up by 0.74 ºC, the temperature in North China has gone up by 1.4 ºC in only 50 years. 
China needs to take quick action to cut carbon dioxide emission (排放), because it’s the main reason for global warming. We plan to cut energy use by 20% and pollution emission by 10% in the 11th Five-Year Plan. 
Can you slow global warming? Sure! You and your family can take steps to cut the amount of carbon dioxide that is sent out into the air. 

Here are some pieces of advice to help you save the earth. Wear used clothes. Wearing your brother’s, sister’s or dad’s old T-shirts means you save the energy. 
 Ride on the bus. Taking a bus saves a lot of oil every year. 
 Open the window. Don’t use the air conditioner (空调), and let some fresh air in. 
When you have to use it, set the temperature higher in summer and lower in winter to save energy. 
Make small changes in your daily life. Don’t use paper cups, bags and boxes. 
 It’s time for all of us to do something to save the earth.

questions.text: Since more than 30 years ago, there has been <blank> according to the passage.

choices.C: the rising of the temperature in South China

questions.explanation: The passage mentions '21 warm winters in China since 1986' and the increase in global temperature.

questions.text: The main reason for global warming is <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states that China needs to cut carbon dioxide emissions because it’s the main reason for global warming.

questions.text: The word “energy” in the second paragraph means “<blank>”.
questions.explanation: In the context of the passage, 'energy' refers to 'energy resources'.

questions.text: Which of the following is true?

choices.A: Using air conditioners may be a waste of energy.
choices.B: It’s funny to wear your dad’s old T-shirts.
choices.C: Taking a bus wastes a lot of oil every year.
choices.D: Using paper bags saves energy a lot.

questions.explanation: The passage advises against using air conditioners to save energy.

questions.text: The passage is mainly about the ways to <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage provides advice on how to reduce carbon dioxide emissions and slow down global warming.

question_sets.context:
Dear Diary，Sept.22nd，2035
    This morning after breakfast，my mum told me to take out the rubbish，but some strange aliens kidnapped（绑架）me and took me to their UFO.It looked really strange like a big ketchup（番茄酱）bottle .
    These aliens looked very weird，too.They were tall，thin and green，looking like big ugly frogs.They told me they were from a planet far，far away.
    I was so scared when I first got kidnapped！The aliens just took me right into their UFO.They tied me up and started asking me all kinds of questions about the Earth.I didn't say anything，no matter what they did.I wasn't going to help them attack（攻击）our planet！After thirty minutes or so，they got really angry and went away.
    When they were gone，I broke the rope（绳子）on my body and ran through the UFO，hiding whenever I heard a noise.Finally，I found a door.There was a strange button（按钮）near the door，so I pushed it.The door started disappearing and the floor was moving！It turned out that I was in a mini﹣rocket.I flew back to the Earth and ran inside my house to give my mum and dad a big hug Bradley.

questions.text: What was Bradley doing when the aliens kidnapped him?

choices.C: He was taking out the rubbish.

questions.explanation: According to the passage, Bradley was taking out the rubbish when the aliens kidnapped him.

questions.text: What does the underlined word "weird" mean?
questions.explanation: "Weird" means strange.

questions.text: Why did the aliens get angry?

choices.C: Because Bradley got on the UFO.

questions.explanation: The aliens got angry because Bradley didn't say anything.

questions.text: What can we learn from the last paragraph?

choices.A: Bradley knew a lot about aliens.
choices.B: Bradley was saved by his parents.
choices.D: Bradley ran away successfully at last.

questions.explanation: Bradley ran away successfully at last.

questions.text: Where is the text probably taken from?
questions.explanation: The text is probably taken from a notebook, as it is written in diary form.

question_sets.context:
Mike will never forget his trip to Bulgaria.He found everything interesting，like the restaurant he went to one day.After he finished his food there，a waiter politely（有礼貌地）asked if he enjoyed it.The food was delicious and the service（服务）was great.So Mike showed that he really loved it by nodding his head.
    Strangely，the waiter did not smile but frowned（皱眉）.It was like that he was not quite happy with Mike's answer.Mike did not know what was wrong and felt very upset（沮丧的）.Luckily，a lady sitting next to him explained in English that in Bulgaria，nodding one's head means"no"and shaking one's head means"yes".This is completely different from Mike's country.
    Mike thanked the kind lady and called the waiter over.He pointed to his plate and shook his head.This time，the waiter smiled and brought him some dessert（甜点）.
    Body language is different from country to country.It is important for us to learn about a country's culture.Take a look at Mike's experience and you will know why.

questions.text: Why did Mike nod his head?

choices.A: Because the waiter made Mike upset.
choices.B: Because the food and service were great.
choices.C: Because he didn't like the food or service.
choices.D: Because he didn't know the waiter's meaning.

questions.explanation: Mike nodded his head because the food and service were great.

questions.text: How did Mike feel when he saw the expression on the waiter's face?
questions.explanation: Mike felt strange and upset when he saw the expression on the waiter's face.

questions.text: In Bulgaria，if people agree with something，they would
questions.explanation: In Bulgaria, if people agree with something, they would shake their heads.

questions.text: Why did Mike call the waiter back?

choices.A: To invite him to visit his country.
choices.B: To teach him some body language.
choices.C: To ask him for some more dessert.
choices.D: To express that he loved the food.

questions.explanation: Mike called the waiter back to express that he loved the food.

questions.text: What can we learn from Mike's experience?

choices.A: Never nod your head to the waiters.
choices.B: It's important for us to learn English well.
choices.C: We should keep smiling and be polite to others.
choices.D: Pay attention to culture differences while traveling.

questions.explanation: We can learn that we should pay attention to culture differences while traveling.

question_sets.context:
Homeless people often feel hopeless.Life is quite difficult for homeless people.There are many programs that try to help homeless people，but not all of them are as creative as Back on My Feet.This program tries to help homeless people improve their lives through running.
    The creator of Back on My Feet is Anne Mahlum.She got the idea after meeting a group of homeless men every day on her morning run.Finally，she asked them to join her on her runs.When they agreed，the first Back on My Feet run took place.
    Since then，Back on My Feet has got popular in many places in the US.Homeless people should attend the runs three or four times a week.Along the way，they will be able to get new running shoes and clothes.After six months of being in the program，they will be able to receive scholarships（奖学金）that go toward housing and they will even be able to find a job.

questions.text: What is Back on My Feet trying to do?
questions.explanation: Back on My Feet is trying to help homeless people.

questions.text: What is the main idea of Paragraph 2?

choices.A: How Back on My Feet works.
choices.B: How Back on My Feet was born.
choices.C: How popular Back on My Feet is.
choices.D: How people join Back on My Feet.

questions.explanation: The main idea of Paragraph 2 is how Back on My Feet was born.

questions.text: How often should people attend the runs?
questions.explanation: People should attend the runs 3 or 4 times a week.

questions.text: What does the writer think of the homeless program in the passage?
questions.explanation: The writer thinks the homeless program is creative.

questions.text: What is the best title for this passage?

choices.D: Joining a running race with homeless.

questions.explanation: The best title for this passage is Helping homeless through running.

question_sets.context:
Dear Sir or Madam，
One of the teachers at my school in New York tells me that your school has summer courses. I am planning to go to Beijing next summer and would like to take a short one-month course. 
I am 18 years old and have been studying Chinese for six years. I was born in the USA and have never been to China before. I am going to study Chinese at the university. I think the course will help me improve my Chinese. 
Could you send me a catalogue（目录）and application form（申请表）？I would also like information about Beijing and other places nearby. I hope to do some travelling when the course is over. 
Thank you！I am looking forward to your reply. 
Very truly yours，
Jim Green

questions.text: Jim Green is a student from___________
questions.explanation: The letter states, "I was born in the USA."

questions.text: He was twelve years old when he started to __________
questions.explanation: He is 18 and has been studying Chinese for 6 years, so he started at 12.

questions.text: How many times has he been to China before？
questions.explanation: The letter says, "I have never been to China before."

questions.text: He will come to China next summer to __________
questions.explanation: He wants to take a course to "improve his Chinese."

questions.text: He will probably after the summer course.
questions.explanation: He hopes "to do some travelling when the course is over."

question_sets.context:
Many kids do housework such as doing the dishes making the bed, and folding the clothes. In exchange, they get some money or other computer time.
Paying kids for housework is one of the most popular topics, especially at a time when everyone is more careful about money. Some parents think since adults are paid to do their jobs, we should pay kids for everyday housework.
But some people don't think kids should get rewards(报酬) for doing housework. Susie Walton, an expert, believe that by rewarding kids, parents are sending a message that work isn't worth doing unless you get something in return. “Running any kind of housework is a team effort,” Walton said. “A home is a living space for everyone in the family. It's important for kids to see that we all have responsibilities in the house, and families decide how they want their home to look, and how they are going to keep it looking like what they want.”
Other people believe that getting a reward encourages kids to do housework, and it also teaches them real world lessons about how we need to work to get money. There are also apps(程序) that gives kids points and digital gifts that can be redeemed(兑现) either online or in the real world. “Our goal is to give kids lawful power so they can get rewards,” says Chris Bergman. “And kids need rewards to help encourage them. ”

questions.text: Which of the following housework is NOT mentioned in Paragraph 1?
questions.explanation: Paragraph 1 mentions dishes, making the bed, and folding clothes but not cooking meals.

questions.text: The underlined phrase “in return” in Paragraph 3 has the same meaning as “_____”.
questions.explanation: 'In return' means receiving something back for something done, which is the same as 'as a reward'.

questions.text: What's Walton's idea in the passage?

choices.A: Running exercise is a kind of team work.
choices.B: People work to get some rewards.
choices.C: Kids have responsibilities in the house.
choices.D: Doing the housework in only the parents' job.

questions.explanation: Walton believes kids should see that they all have responsibilities in the house.

questions.text: According to Chris Bergman, kids should be encouraged to ______.
questions.explanation: Bergman says "kids need rewards to help encourage them."

questions.text: Which is the best title for the passage?

choices.A: Kids Should Study as Well as Doing Housework
choices.C: Should Kids Be Rewarded for Doing Housework
choices.D: Doing Housework Is Good for Children's Study

questions.explanation: The passage discusses the debate over whether kids should be rewarded for housework.

question_sets.context:
Last summer I went to one of the world's most famous historical places，the Forbidden City in Beijing，China．It was the home of the emperors of the last two dynasties in China，the Ming and Qing Dynasties．
 The Forbidden City was built in 1420．The palace has over 10，000 rooms．It was where the emperors dealt with the official business with their ministers．
 In Mandarin(普通话), the Forbidden City is called the Purple Forbidden City. However，the color of the palace itself is not purple. The color purple stands for power of the great emperors of China．It was so sacred（神圣的） that the commoners could not even dream of ever going in．
 The emperors also had some of the largest festival celebrations at the Forbidden City．During Chinese New Year，the emperor would invite all the members of his family and his officials to a banquet. The banquet had a hundred and eight Chinese dishes．It was such an expensive banquet that it could feed a commoner's family for three generations（代）．
Right now The Forbidden City is known as a historical site for tourists from all over the world．Everyone can go in there．It is a museum with priceless Chinese antiques（古董）and treasures in it．
 I really learned a lot about the Chinese culture and its history from this trip to The Forbidden City．It was like a dream come true to go on the trip and see the things that I have always wanted to see．

questions.text: How long is the history of the Forbidden City？
questions.explanation: The Forbidden City was built in 1420, making its history about 600 years long.

questions.text: We call the palace the Purple Forbidden City because the color purple is the symbol for_______ of the emperor．
questions.explanation: The passage states, "The color purple stands for power of the great emperors of China."

questions.text: What's the Chinese meaning of the underlined word "banquet" in Paragraph 4？
questions.explanation: "Banquet" refers to a large formal meal, which translates to 宴会 in Chinese.

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT true about the Forbidden City in the passage？

choices.B: It is a historical place for visiting
choices.C: The wall of the City was purple
choices.D: The emperor had festival celebrations there

questions.explanation: The passage mentions the emperors living there, it being a historical site, and festival celebrations. It doesn't mention the wall color.

questions.text: In the passage the writer wants to show us _______of the Forbidden City by comparing its past with present．
questions.explanation: The passage compares the Forbidden City as the home of emperors to its current use as a tourist site.

question_sets.context:
In different countries around the world, most children must start schooling at early ages. And they become "adults" at different ages. Being an adult means having the right to do certain things, such as getting a part-time job, voting (投票), getting married, or getting a driving license. It also means accepting the responsibilities that go along with these rights.
In many countries, sixteen or eighteen is the age when a person becomes an adult. Young men and women at this age can get a part-time job, and begin to receive an income of their own.
They no longer have to depend on their parents for money all the time. In Canada and America, sixteen is the age when one can get a driving license;  in England, it is seventeen.
There are responsibilities that go along with both of these rights. Getting a part-time job means that you have to pay income tax. Driving a car demands that you follow certain rules like buying car insurance.
Voting is another right that young people enjoy when they become adults. In the United States, Canada and Britain, young people have the right to vote at the age of eighteen. With this right also comes responsibility. For young people to use their right to vote wisely, they must have an understanding of the needs of society, and they must also learn how politics work.

questions.text: The underlined word "right" in Paragraph One means 　   　 in Chinese.
questions.explanation: The context discusses freedoms and entitlements, so "right" means 权利 (rights/entitlement).

questions.text: In America and Canada, young people who are 　   　 can get their driving licenses.
questions.explanation: The passage states, "In Canada and America, sixteen is the age when one can get a driving license."

questions.text: If you drive a car, you have to 　   　.
questions.explanation: Driving a car requires following rules such as buying car insurance.

questions.text: Tom is a 17-year-old English boy and he has the rights to 　   　.
questions.explanation: In England, the driving age is 17, and everyone has the right to learn.

questions.text: From the passage, we can know that 　   　.

choices.A: sixteen-year-olds have all kinds of rights
choices.B: responsibilities need to go along with rights
choices.C: the rules are the same in the UK and the USA

questions.explanation: The passage emphasizes that responsibilities are connected to rights.

question_sets.context:
Almost everyone likes dogs, and almost everyone likes to read stories about dogs. I have a friend. He has a large police dog named Jack. Police dogs are very clever. Every Sunday afternoon my friend takes Jack for a long walk in the park. Jack like these long walks very much.
One Sunday afternoon a young man came to visit my friend. He stayed a long time. He talked and talked. Soon it was time for my friend to take Jack for his walk. But the visitor still stayed. Jack became very worried. He walked around the room several times and then sat down in front of the visitor and looked at him. But the visitor paid not attention. He went on talking. Finally Jack got angry. He went out of the room and came back a few minutes later. He sat down again in front of the visitor, but this time he took the visitor's cap in his mouth.

questions.text: The young visitor stayed a long time, didn't he?
questions.explanation: According to the passage, "He stayed a long time."

questions.text: Jack became very worried because <blank>.

choices.A: he wanted to have something to eat
choices.B: he wanted to play with him
choices.D: he didn't know the young man

questions.explanation: According to the passage, "Soon it was time for my friend to take Jack for his walk. But the visitor still stayed. Jack became very worried."

questions.text: Jack sat down in front of the visitor because <blank>.

choices.A: he wanted to join the talk
choices.B: he wanted the visitor to leave
choices.C: he wanted the visitor to talk with him
choices.D: he wanted to show the visitor how clever he was

questions.explanation: Jack wanted the visitor to leave so that he could go for a walk.

questions.text: The visitor went on talking and <blank>.

choices.B: he paid no attention to Jack
choices.C: he paid no attention to his cap
choices.D: he didn't care that his cap was his cap was taken away by Jack

questions.explanation: According to the passage, "But the visitor paid not attention. He went on talking."

questions.text: Jack went out of the room with nothing, but came back with <blank> in his mouth.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, "He went out of the room and came back a few minutes later...but this time he took the visitor's cap in his mouth."

question_sets.context: Mr White and his wife wanted to paint(油漆) the outside of their house. To save(节省) money they wanted to do it themselves. On Saturday morning they bought some paint and two brushes(刷子). They began that afternoon with the back ol the house. The next Saturday Mr White went to a football match(比赛) but his wife painted the front of the house. On Sunday they found they couldn't open any of the front windows. They got them all open in the end. But they broke three of the seven. They were very dear to mend. Next time when they want to save money they’ll certainly ask somebody to do the work.

questions.text: Mr White wanted to paint <blank>.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, "Mr White and his wife wanted to paint(油漆) the outside of their house."

questions.text: They wanted to do the work themselves because<blank>.

choices.A: the windows were very easy to break
choices.B: the windows were very hard to open
choices.C: nobody could do this work well
choices.D: they didn't want to give more money

questions.explanation: According to the passage, "To save(节省) money they wanted to do it themselves."

questions.text: The work lasted for about <blank>.
questions.explanation: The work lasted from Saturday to the next Sunday.

questions.text: They have to ask somebody to mend the <blank> windows.
questions.explanation: According to the passage, "But they broke three of the seven."

questions.text: Next time they will ask somebody to work for them because

choices.A: they want to go to football matches
choices.B: it is no longer an interesting thing for them
choices.C: they have no more paint and brushes
choices.D: they really want to save some money

questions.explanation: According to the passage, "Next time when they want to save money they’ll certainly ask somebody to do the work."

question_sets.context:
After breakfast Mrs. Beckman started packing（打包）the bags. She bought the tickets to London. Her husband works there and she and her children are going to fly there to see him. Thomas and Katy can’t help her and she told them to play outside.
“It often rains in London in autumn, ”the woman said to herself, “ I’d better take the umbrellas. So I won’t buy any when it rains there.”
Suddenly(突然),she heard Thomas crying and ran out at once. She asked, ”What’s the matter?”
“Katty pulled(揪)my hair,” the boy said .
“Don’t be angry,” said the woman. “She’s too young. She doesn’t know pulling hair hurts(疼痛)”
And then she went to the house again. After a short time there was more crying. She had to come out to see what the matter was.
This time Thomas said, “Now she knows.”

questions.text: Mr Beckman works in          .
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that Mrs. Beckman bought tickets to London where her husband works.

questions.text: Mrs Beckman will go to London by      .
questions.explanation: The passage says 'she and her children are going to fly there'.

questions.text: , so they can’t help their mother.

choices.A: The two children are too young
choices.D: The two children want to rest

questions.explanation: The passage says 'Thomas and Katy can’t help her and she told them to play outside,' implying they are too young to help.

questions.text: Thomas cried because
questions.explanation: The passage states that Thomas cried because 'Katty pulled my hair'.

questions.text: Thomas wanted                 .

choices.C: Katy to know pulling hair hurt.
choices.D: Katy to go in the house

questions.explanation: Thomas said 'Now she knows,' implying he wanted Katy to understand that pulling hair hurts.

question_sets.context:
Newton was born on Christmas, 1642,in a small village in England. 
   His father, a farmer, died when he was young. He liked to repair clocks and make toys. He also was interested in astronomy(天文学).
   Newton went t school at twelve. Soon after he had to stop as his mother wanted him to do farm work. When she found her son was so interested in science, Mrs. Newton sent him to Cambridge(剑桥) University to study. He was 19 at that time.
   Sometimes he had to work as a servant to go on his study. There he became a famous scientist. At 23 he invented methods of calculation(计算) which have been used to nowadays. In 1665 he had to leave the university and go home where he made two of his great discoveries. One is that he found the colour of sunlight was made up of seven kinds. The other was the founding of force of gravity(地心引力),which was one of the most important theories(理论) for modern science.

questions.text: Newton was a great scientist. He<blank>
questions.explanation: The passage explicitly states that Newton discovered the force of gravity.

questions.text: Mrs. Newton hoped her son could become a <blank>.
questions.explanation: Initially, Mrs. Newton wanted him to do farm work, but later she recognized his interest in science and sent him to university.

questions.text: In Cambridge Newton often worked as a <blank> to go on his study.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that Newton worked as a servant to continue his studies.

questions.text: Newton’s first discovery was<blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage says, "One is that he found the colour of sunlight was made up of seven kinds."

questions.text: Newton stopped studying when he was young, because<blank>.

choices.B: his mother wanted him to be a farmer

questions.explanation: The passage indicates that he had to stop studying because his mother wanted him to do farm work.

question_sets.context:
Visit Forest Zoo
  Come and see the Indian elephants and the new tigers from Northeast of China. The beautiful birds from England are ready to sing for you, and the monkeys from Mount Emei will be ready to talk to you. The lovely dogs from Australia want to smile at you. Sichuan pandas will play balls for you. The giraffes(长颈鹿) from Africa are waiting to look down at you.
         Tickets 
   Grown-ups (成年人):￥3
   Children: Over1.4m:￥2
           Under1.4m: Free 
          Opening time
   9:00 a.m~4:00 p.m. ,every day
 except Friday
10:00 a.m.~3:00 p.m.
   Keep the zoo clean!
   Do not touch, give food or go near to the animals.

questions.text: Why does the writer introduce so many animals from different places to us?

choices.A: To show animals can do everything.
choices.B: To make us lovely in the zoo.
choices.C: To attract us to the zoo.

questions.explanation: The purpose is to attract visitors by showcasing a variety of animals from different regions.

questions.text: How much does Mr. Smith have to pay if he visits the zoo with his son of three?
questions.explanation: Since the son is three, he is under 1.4m and enters for free. Mr. Smith, as a grown-up, pays ￥3.

questions.text: At which of the following time can we vistt the zoo?
questions.explanation: The zoo is open from 9:00 a.m to 4:00 p.m every day except Friday. 3:30 p.m. Sunday falls within the given opening hours.

questions.text: What should we do in the zoo?
questions.explanation: The passage clearly states, "Keep the zoo clean!"

questions.text: From the passage , we can infer(推断) a giraffe must be a very <blank>animal.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that giraffes are "waiting to look down at you," implying that they are tall animals.

question_sets.context:
American people like to say “Thank you” when others help them or say something kind to them. People of many countries do so, too. It is a very good habit(习惯).
You should say “Thank you” when someone passes you the salt on the table, when someone walking ahead of you keeps the door open for you, when someone says you have done your work well, or you have bought a nice thing, or your city is very beautiful. “Thank you” is used not only between friends, but also between parents and children, brothers and sisters.
“Excuse me” is another short sentence they use. When you hear someone say so behind you, you know that somebody wants to walk past you without touching you. It’s not polite to break others when they are talking. If you want to speak to one of them, say, “Excuse me” first, and then begin talking. You should also do so when you begin to cough or make any noise before others.
Let’s learn to say “Thank you” and “Excuse me”.

questions.text: You should say “Thank you” when <blank>.

choices.A: you say something kind to others
choices.D: you need others to help you

questions.explanation: The passage states that 'Thank you' is said when 'others help them'.

questions.text: From the passage we know “Thank you” is <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions that 'People of many countries do so, too'.

questions.text: You should say “Excuse me” if you want to <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage states 'If you want to speak to one of them, say, “Excuse me” first'.

questions.text: When you are going to ask someone to tell you the way, you should say “<blank>”.
questions.explanation: The most polite way to interrupt or ask for assistance is to say 'Excuse me'.

questions.text: This passage mainly tells us the way <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage explains when to use 'Thank you' and 'Excuse me' to be polite.

question_sets.context:
In England, people often talk about the weather because they can experience (经历) four seasons in one day. In the morning the weather is warm just like in spring. An hour later black clouds come and then it rains hard. The weather gets a little cold. In the late afternoon the sky  will be sunny. The sun will begin to shine, and it will be summer at this time of a day.
In England, people can also have summer in winter, or have winter in summer. So in winter they can swim sometimes, and in summer sometimes they should take warm clothes.
When you go to England, you will see that some English people usually take an umbrella (伞)or a raincoat with them in the sunny morning, but you should not laugh at them.
If you don't take an umbrella or a raincoat, you will regret (后悔) later in the day.

questions.text: Why do people in England often talk about the weather?

choices.A: Because they may have four seasons in one day
choices.B: Because they often have very good weather
choices.C: Because the weather is warm just like in spring
choices.D: Because the sky is sunny all day

questions.explanation: The passage directly states, 'because they can experience four seasons in one day'.

questions.text: From the story we know that when <blank> come, there is a heavy rain.
questions.explanation: The passage mentions, 'An hour later black clouds come and then it rains hard'.

questions.text: "People can also have summer in winter." Means "it is sometimes too <blank> in winter."
questions.explanation: 'Summer in winter' implies it's unseasonably warm.

questions.text: In the sunny morning some English people usually take a raincoat or an umbrella with them because <blank>.

choices.A: their friends ask them to do so
choices.C: they are going to sell them

questions.explanation: The passage suggests, 'If you don't take an umbrella or a raincoat, you will regret later in the day'.

questions.text: The best title (标题)for this passage is <blank>.
questions.explanation: The whole passage is talking about the weather in England.

question_sets.context:
Mr. Hunt works in a middle school. He teaches English there. He works hard and hopes all his students can be good at their lessons. He always thinks “Practice makes perfect” and tells them to do more exercises after school.
One morning Mr. Hunt came into the classroom when the bell rang. All the students stood up except Peter. He went to him and found the young man was asleep. He woke him up. The young man looked around and stood up, with a red face.
“What’s wrong with you, Peter?” asked Mr. Hunt.
“Nothing, sir.” answered the young man. “I only feel tired.”
“Weren’t you asleep last night?”
“ No, I wasn’t.”
“What did you do then?”
“I did some of the homework yesterday evening,” said Peter, “some of it in the middle of the night, and the rest of it early this morning.”

questions.text: What does Mr. Hunt teach in the school?
questions.explanation: The passage says 'He teaches English there'.

questions.text: Peter didn’t stand up because <blank>.

choices.B: he didn’t see Mr. Hunt come in
choices.D: he was sleeping when Mr. Hunt came in

questions.explanation: The passage indicates 'He went to him and found the young man was asleep'.

questions.text: Peter was asleep this morning because <blank>.

choices.C: he did his homework all night
choices.D: he wasn’t good at his lessons

questions.explanation: Peter said that he did some of the homework yesterday evening, some of it in the middle of the night, and the rest of it early this morning.

questions.text: Peter’s answer meant that <blank>.

choices.A: Mr. Hunt was a good teacher
choices.B: they had too much homework to do
choices.C: he hoped to be at home
choices.D: he didn’t want to go to school

questions.explanation: Because Peter said 'I did some of the homework yesterday evening, some of it in the middle of the night, and the rest of it early this morning', so the answer is B.

questions.text: How do you think about Peter?

choices.C: He is not a good student.

questions.explanation: Peter was late for class and slept in class, so the answer is C.
questions.test_point: Reading Comprehension; Inference Skills; Author’s Purpose

question_sets.context:
Long, long ago there was no zero. To write the number sixty-three people wrote 63. To write six hundred and three, people wrote 6 3. The space between six and three was there to mean." not any letter". Sometimes people did not remember the space. It was hard to see and read.
Later people used a dot to hold the space. Six hundred and three looked like this 6.3. But the dot was hard to see. So people put a circle around it like this 6⊙3. Then people could see the dot. They remembered the space. At last, only the circle around the dot was used. It was like a zero. This is one story of how the zero came to be used.
Now zero has many important uses. Zero tells how many. Can you tell some other ways of using zero?

questions.text: Long, long ago people didn't know how to <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage starts with 'Long, long ago there was no zero'.

questions.text: Long, long ago if they wrote two hundred-eight, people wrote <blank>.
questions.explanation: The passage implies a space was used for missing digits.

questions.text: Later <blank> was used to mean space.
questions.explanation: The passage states 'Later people used a dot to hold the space'.

questions.text: People used circles <blank>.
questions.explanation: The dot was hard to see, so people put a circle around it to remeber the space.

questions.text: The story tells us <blank>.

choices.A: how zero came to be used
choices.D: that zero means a dot, a circle or space.

questions.explanation: The passage is 'one story of how the zero came to be used'.

question_sets.context:
Dolphins are one of the cleverest animals in the world. We may hear of many stories about how dolphins save people out of water. 
Dolphins often eat fish and some other sea animals. A dolphin with a weight of 200kg to 250kg will eat 10kg to 25kg of fish every day. They like to swim with other dolphins and usually hunt in groups. 
Dolphins have very good hearing. They use it to find things under the water. Many scientists also believe dolphins can even talk to each other through a special whistle (哨声). People from different areas don’t speak the same language. Just like people, dolphins’ whistles have many kinds. One day we may understand dolphins’ whistles, and then they will be able to tell us about themselves. 


Dolphins live in the sea, but they are not a kind of fish and they don’t lay eggs. They have babies in the same way as cows and cats do, and give their babies milk. A female dolphin has a baby every two to three years. 
Dolphins are very friendly. Sadly, there are not many kinds of dolphins left. People killed them for many years for food and other things. Now it’s time to stop this and perhaps there will be more of them in the years to come.

questions.text: If a dolphin weighs 240kg, how much of fish may it eat every day?
questions.explanation: The passage says that a dolphin with a weight of 200kg to 250kg will eat 10kg to 25kg of fish every day. 240kg is between 200kg and 250kg, so 16kg is a reasonable amount.

questions.text: How do dolphins find things under the water?
questions.explanation: The passage states that dolphins have very good hearing and use it to find things under the water.

questions.text: What can’t dolphins do according to this passage?
questions.explanation: The passage says that dolphins are not a kind of fish and they don’t lay eggs.

questions.text: Which of the following is right except ________?

choices.A: Dolphins are a kind of fish.
choices.B: Dolphins eat fish and some other sea animals.
choices.C: People may understand dolphins’ whistles some day.

questions.explanation: The passage states that dolphins live in the sea, but they are not a kind of fish.

questions.text: Which is the best title for the passage?
questions.explanation: The passage discusses various aspects of dolphins, so 'Something about dolphins' is the most appropriate title.

question_sets.context:
An old man was fishing on the bank of a river. A child came to see him fishing. The old man was really good at fishing and it didn’t take long for him to catch a full basket of fish. The old man saw that the child was very cute, and he wanted to give her a whole basket of fish. But the child shook her head. The old man was surprised and asked, “Why don’t you want the fish?” The child replied, “I want the fishing rod (竿)in your hands. ”
The old man asked, “Why do you want the rod?”
“It doesn’t take long to eat all the fish in a basket. But if I have the fishing rod, I can go fishing by myself and I won’t be afraid of not having any more fish to eat.”
I think you will certainly say that the child is very smart. Wrong! If she doesn’t know how to fish, she cannot have fish to eat, even though (尽管)she has the fishing rod. It’s useless to only have a fishing rod. Fishing skills are the most important, not the fishing rod.
Too many people think that if they have a “fishing rod” in their life, they will no longer fear the wind and rain. They are just like the child, who thought that if she had a fishing rod, she would have fish to eat.

questions.text: The old man was fishing on the bank of <blank>.
questions.explanation: The first sentence in the passage states that 'An old man was fishing on the bank of a river'.

questions.text: Why did the child refuse the fish the old man gave her?

choices.B: Because she wanted his fishing rod.
choices.C: Because the old man had few fish.

questions.explanation: The child said, 'I want the fishing rod in your hands'.

questions.text: The writer thought the child was <blank> after she explained (解释) why she didn’t want the fish.
questions.explanation: The writer states 'I think you will certainly say that the child is very smart. Wrong!' suggesting the writer thought the child was foolish.

questions.text: The article mainly tells us <blank>.

choices.A: if you have a “fishing rod” in your life, you won’t be afraid of anything
choices.B: if you have a fishing rod, you’ll have a lot of fish to eat
choices.C: “fishing skills” are more important than “the fishing rod” in life

questions.explanation: The passage emphasizes that 'Fishing skills are the most important, not the fishing rod'.

questions.text: What is the best title (标题) for the article?
questions.explanation: The passage is about the importance of fishing skills over only having the fishing rod, so 'The Fishing Rod' is more representative.
